cards.definition: The molecule inside cells that contains the genetic information responsible for the development and function of an organism.
A structure found inside the nucleus of a cell. A chromosome is made up of proteins and DNA organized into genes. Each cell normally contains 23 pairs of chromosomes.
An allele is one of two or more versions of DNA sequence (a single base or a segment of bases) at a given genomic location.
By convention the chromosomes are arranged into the pattern shown above and the resulting image is called a karyogram.
Cells with only one set of chromosomes are haploid and are labelled with n
Cells with two sets of chromosomes are diploid and are labelled with 2n
The genetic makeup of an organism is called its genotype
Organism's observable traits are its phenotype
Device used to measure the amount of energy produced in a chemical reaction.
Transfer of Phospahte from ATP to another molecule
Energy gain (producing ATP) without the presence of oxygen
The division can be occured with Binary Fision or Clones
There are two main phases in division of Eukaryotic cell. These are Interphase and Mitotic phase
The stage in the development of a cell between two successive divisions
The phase which includes two division. These are Mitosis and Cytokinesis.

cards.term: How many stages are there in Interphase?
cards.definition: Interphase is composed of G1 phase (cell growth), followed by S phase (DNA synthesis), followed by G2 phase (cell growth).
Mitosis is a process of cell duplication, in which one cell divides into two genetically identical daughter cells
A special form of cell division in which each daughter cell receives half the amount of DNA as the parent cell. Meiosis occurs during formation of egg and sperm cells in mammals.
It helps with cell division for animal cells
There are 4 stages of mitosis. These are Prophase, Metaphase, Anaphase, Telophase
There are totally 8 stages of Meiosis because the cell division occurs twice in Meiosis. These are Prophase 1, Metaphase 1, Anaphase 1, Telophase 1, Prophase 2, Metaphase 2, Anaphase 2, Telophase 2
All ancient civilizations knew slavery such as Ancient Egypt, Mesopotamia, Greeks and Romans.
Segment of the global slave trade that transported between 10 million and 12 million enslaved Africans across the Atlantic Ocean to the Americas from the 16th to the 19th century.

The trade routes formed a triangle, becoming known as the triangular trade. These routes were used many times for Manufactured goods from Europe to Africa, Slaves from Africa to the Americas, Raw materials (cotton, tobacco, sugar) to Europe.

cards.term: Abolition of Slavery in British Empire
cards.definition: 1807 = slave trade abolished in British Empire -> no slaves  carried from Africa in British ships.

Colonialism is a policy of control by one people or power over other people or areas, often by establishing colonies and generally with the aim of economic dominance. In the process of colonisation, colonisers may impose their religion, language, economics, and other cultural practices.

Imperialism is a state policy or a political strategy that consists in extending power by territorial acquisition or by extending political and economic control outward over other areas. Imperialism oftentimes involves the use of military and economic power, and always aims for more expansion and collective or individual domination.
There are four forms of Imperialism. These are Colony, Sphere of Influence, Economic Imperialism and Protectorate

The gas laws were developed at the end of the 18th century, when scientists began to realize that relationships between pressure, volume and temperature of a sample of gas could be obtained which would hold to approximation for all gases.
Boyle's Law states that the volume of a given amount of gas held at constant temperature varies inversely with the applied pressure when the temperature and mass are constant.
Charles's law, a statement that the volume occupied by a fixed amount of gas is directly proportional to its absolute temperature, if the pressure remains constant.
Gay Lussac's Law states that the pressure of a given amount of gas held at constant volume is directly proportional to the Kelvin temperature.

Amadeo Avogadro was an Italian physicist who stated, in 1811, that the volume of any gas is proportional to the number of molecules of gas (measured in Moles – symbol mol). In other words if the amount of gas increases, then so does its volume.

The ideal gas law, also called the general gas equation, is the equation of state of a hypothetical ideal gas. It is a good approximation of the behavior of many gases under many conditions, although it has several limitations. It was first stated by Benoît Paul Émile Clapeyron in 1834 as a combination of the empirical Boyle's law, Charles's law, Avogadro's law, and Gay-Lussac's law.
